definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

pinyin: pai2 wu1 di4 xia4 zhu3 guan3 wang3

sentences.english: That's the lowest -ranking officer position in most banks.
sentences.chinese: 助理司庫是大多數銀行中主管級別中最低的一級。

sentences.english: As a safeguard, officers-in-charge of departments are requested to verify identification by comparing signatures.
sentences.chinese: 爲安全起見，部門負責主管應比對簽字檢驗身份。

sentences.english: Shortly afterward, the Anyuanding executives were detained.
sentences.chinese: 不久之後，安元鼎主管被拘留。

sentences.english: Do you happen to know Mr. Johnson in the Marketing Department?
sentences.chinese: 宮先生是銷售和市場部主管。

sentences.english: For registered mail, compensation shall be made according to standard amounts formulated by the competent department of postal services under the State Council.
sentences.chinese: 掛號信件，按照國務院郵政主管部門規定的金額賠償。

sentences.english: My supervisor often likes to make mountains out of molehills.
sentences.chinese: 我的主管常常喜歡小題大作。

sentences.english: The competent authorities shall impose necessary administrative and disciplinary sanctions on those who have violated the aforesaid provisions.
sentences.chinese: 違反者，主管部門應給予必要的行政或紀律處分。

sentences.english: They have performed really, really well, ' according to buying director Holli Rogers.
sentences.chinese: 該網站採購主管羅傑斯說，燈籠褲賣的真的非常好。

sentences.english: They were listening to an expert who is in charge of meteorites at the Smithsonian.
sentences.chinese: 他們在聽專家講解，她是史密斯松寧主管隕石的專家。

sentences.english: Article 7 The department of finance under the State Council shall administer the accounting work throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 第七條國務院財政部門主管全國的會計工作。

sentences.english: The teller then takes the withdrawal slip to a bank officer for approval.
sentences.chinese: 然後出納員將此取款單交給銀行主管人以獲得批准。

sentences.english: Local authorities must refer everything to the central ministries.
sentences.chinese: 地方管理機構應請示中央主管部門。

sentences.english: A matronly head appeared around a door.
sentences.chinese: 一個主管模樣的人出現在門口。

sentences.english: For executives, it is common to have longer-term rewards such as stock options.
sentences.chinese: 對於主管們，長期的酬謝包括認股權。

sentences.english: The civil aviation authority has already approved Wang's application for the suspension.
sentences.chinese: 民航主管部門已批准王均金的書面停航申請。

definition: to be put in charge of/to be responsible for/branched passage
head/director (of an organizational unit)/(police) commissioner/inspector-general/rank of local governor in Tang dynasty administration
head of a (government etc) department/section chief/section head/secretary/minister/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
to hold an office or post
